snippet: The prime minister, Hwang Kyo-ahn, told rural residents that South Korea needed the Thaad system to defend against North Korean missiles....
abstract: Residents of Seongju, South Korea, pelt Prime Min Hwang Kyo-ahn with eggs and water bottles in protest of decision to allow United States to build missile defense system there; villagers fear presence of missiles will harm their health and crops; Hwang argues missiles are necessary as defense against North Korea.
lead_paragraph: The prime minister, Hwang Kyo-ahn, told rural residents that South Korea needed the Thaad system to defend against North Korean missiles.

headline.main: South Korean Villagers Pelt Premier With Eggs Over Missile Site
headline.print_headline: South Koreans Pelt Premier With Eggs Over Missile Site

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
